div.style: display: inline-block; background-color: #d9e0e7; padding: 6px; margin: 4px; border: 1px solid #8da1b4; border-radius: 5px; line-height: 60%

p.b: This code system defines the following properties for its concepts

tr.td: True if the concept is not considered active.

div.p: This case-insensitive code system https://IntelliSOFT-Consulting.github.io/HIV-FHIR-IG/CodeSystem/CIEL defines the following codes:

tr.td: A patient who is being seen outside of their regular care setting temporarily to receive medication refills, etc.
Patient transferred out to other services
When were the antiretroviral drugs started for the patient?
Adverse reaction to a drug (oral, parenteral, topical).
Failure of a therapy or treatment to achieve its end points.
Patient unable to pay for treatment.
Combination drug also known as Rifater. Used in the early treatment of tuberculosis.
Alteration in a patient's weight. Could represent either a weight gain or loss.
Combination drug used to treat tuberculosis, often used with other drugs. It's also known as Ethizide.
Fixed-dose combination drug used to treat tuberculosis. Also known as Rifafour.
Question on encounter form. Part of the plan gathers a reason for stopping ARVs. This concept captures that information.
Part of the encounter form plan. Answers are drugs started at the end of the particular encounter.
Answer on encounter form. Implies that a patient's current drugs will be changed to meet a new formulation.
Answer to question. Implies that a person completed a course of total prevention of mother to child transmission therapy.
Combination drug also known as Rifinah. Used in the early treatment of tuberculosis.
Drugs/medications unavailable for use to treat patient. A reason for not receiving/taking medications.
A generic, descriptive answer which is a handwritten, non-coded response to a question.
A crystalline antibacterial compound (C6H7N3O) used in the treatment of tuberculosis.
Anti-mycobaterial drug used to treat active tuberculosis. Always used with other antimycobacterial agents.
Antituberculosis agent used to treat patients with active tuberculosis, usually in combination with other agents.
Patient or client refusal of or resistance to medical, psychological, or psychiatric treatment. (APA, Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms, 8th ed.)
Not following the prescribed course of therapy or not taking prescribed medicines.
Generic answer to a question. For example, a patient stops a medication because of his or her age.
Question on encounter form: "Is the child currently being breastfed?"
Link to new patient identifier if patient has transferred out of facility
Reason for lost to follow up
Why the patient did not follow up with the health care?
People with whom the client lives in the same geographical area or neighborhood
mobile voluntary counseling and testing program
Includes the spectrum of human immunodeficiency virus infections that range from asymptomatic seropositivity, thru AIDS-related complex (ARC), to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).
Response to a finding or test result.
Question on encounter form. The date the patient was removed from the HIV program.
Patients that are lost to followup.. boolean question.
Fecha en la que se suspendió el tratamiento
Fármaco no disponible - no hay reserva
rechazo del tratamiento por el paciente
Refus de traitement par le patient
Le non-respect d'un traitement ou d'une thérapie
Ki pa konfòm avèk tretman oswa terapi
Tretman pa janm kòmanse - pasyan refize
Cirugía intersexual, conversión de sexo femenino a sexo masculino
Ap bay tete nan moman a
Programme de dépistage du VIH à domicile
virus de la inmunodeficiencia humana positivo
Date de fin du programme VIH
